title: Color Palette
description: Color design tokens with support for semantic naming and variants

^[a-z]+(-[a-z]+)*$.description: Color value in hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, or hsla format

x-notes: Variants can be indicated with suffixes like -hover, -light, -dark
Consider semantic naming (primary, secondary) alongside descriptive naming (red, blue)

x-specs.given: a color palette with semantic colors (primary, secondary)
x-specs.when: colors are defined with hex values
x-specs.then: it should validate 6-digit hex colors at build time

x-specs.given: a color with 8-digit hex value for transparency
x-specs.then: it should validate 8-digit hex colors with opacity at build time

assertions: 8 digits: 6 for color + 2 for alpha (80 = 50% opacity)

x-specs.then: it should validate rgb color format at build time

x-specs.given: a color with rgba() format for transparency
x-specs.then: it should validate rgba color format with alpha at build time

assertions: Four values: red, green, blue (0-255), alpha (0-1)

x-specs.then: it should validate hsl color format at build time

x-specs.given: a color with hsla() format for transparency
x-specs.then: it should validate hsla color format with alpha at build time

assertions: Four values: hue, saturation, lightness, alpha

x-specs.then: it should validate color variants for hover states and tints

x-specs.given: gray scale with numbered variants (gray-100 to gray-900)
x-specs.then: it should validate numbered color scales for systematic gradients

assertions: Progressive darkening: each step darker than previous

x-specs.given: a complete color system with semantic, descriptive, and variant colors
x-specs.when: palette includes primary, secondary, success, danger, warning, info, light, dark, grays
x-specs.then: it should validate comprehensive color system for all UI needs

assertions: State colors: success, danger, warning, info (feedback)
Complete palette covers all UI color needs

x-specs.when: color names use multi-word kebab-case format
x-specs.then: it should validate kebab-case naming convention

x-specs.given: primary color used in button component
x-specs.then: it should render button with primary background color
it should render darker blue on hover
it should render text with theme text color

assertions: Muted variant available for secondary text

x-specs.then: it should render green alert indicating success state

x-specs.given: gray scale used in UI hierarchy
x-specs.when: components use gray-100 to gray-900 for depth
x-specs.then: it should create visual hierarchy through tonal variation

assertions: Systematic gray scale creates depth hierarchy

x-specs.given: complete application configuration with all features
x-specs.then: user can complete full colors workflow

workflow.action: User defines complete color palette in theme.colors with semantic colors (primary, secondary, success, danger), gray scale (gray-100 to gray-900), and variants (primary-hover, primary-light)
workflow.validation: All color values validate as hex (#007bff), rgb (rgb(255,0,0)), rgba (rgba(255,0,0,0.5)), hsl (hsl(210,100%,50%)), or hsla (hsla(210,100%,50%,0.8)) formats
workflow.expectedState: Color tokens stored in theme.colors object available for component references

workflow.action: System generates CSS custom properties at :root level for all defined colors
workflow.validation: CSS variables created with --color-{name} syntax for each color token

workflow.action: Components reference color tokens via theme.colors.primary in button, alert, badge, and semantic HTML elements
workflow.validation: All components use theme colors, no hardcoded color values in component definitions
workflow.expectedState: Buttons use primary/secondary colors, alerts use success/danger/warning colors, text uses gray scale

workflow.action: User views application with fully themed colors across all UI components
workflow.validation: Consistent branded appearance with color system applied to buttons, backgrounds, text, borders, and states
workflow.expectedState: Complete visual design system with cohesive color usage throughout application
